Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery large closed vessel, possibly a hydria; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of horse's head to right, with added white studs on bridle and white teeth; male figure on right (left hand holding horse's muzzle remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 467-8, no. B799)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0112) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (P. 96, pl. III, no. 7)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
